author: Marlee Ann-Marie
text: 'Avoid delivery if you can. First time I ordered they messed up the order but they refunded us which was nice.\n\nSecond time - I ordered the Hoboken Lobster Roll & it was disappointing. It was just on a romaine leaf - except the leaf was wilted due to the heat from the fries thrown on top. Not crisp and fresh like someone would expect a lettuce wrap to be. Would be better to keep the greens separate for delivering something like this. The amount of lobster was also disappointing.'

author: Andrew Price
text: 'Food was delicious
column5: but the Bed-stuy Biggie Roll (the one on the right in my side by side photo) had less lobster than the $6 cheaper BK Sauce Roll.'

author: Kaylla Silva
text: 'Very delicious food and very attentive staff!'

author: Leslie Howard
text: "Food was not as described - not made of claw meat. More like a spread into roll. Delivery went to wrong bldg then didn't follow provided instructions to get into bldg. Unlikely to order again. This is what a lobster roll is supposed to look like. That is NOT what you get from BK Hoboken."

author: Valentina Herrera
text: 'I was talking on the phone with a friend when they said they knew a great hot dog spot in Hoboken. I said lets go and have dinner there
column5: turns out its not hot dogs but lobster rolls... We ended up staying because of the menu options. I ordered the flatbush roll
column6: it has a jamaican jerk seasoning. I wanted something spicy and to burn my mouth but it was more of a bbq sauce. Too sweet and it fought against the already sweet lobster meat. The bun was delicious
column7: toasty and buttery and those fries! Wow those fries were seasoned perfectly and crisp outside with a fluffy inside. When I come back I might opt for a more simple seasoning
column8: that way I can enjoy the sweet lobster meat. The service was excellent
column9: the chef and cashier were sweet
column10: helpful and offered great service. There are tables you can sit outside and inside the location. The prices are quite fair for what you are receiving
column11: a loaded bun with lobster and a huge amount of fries.'

author: Dashawnia Magazine
text: 'Me and my friends went to BK lobster today and literally everything was delicious!!! We ordered BK lobster Roll
column5: Bed stey Roll
column6: lobster fries
column8: lobster Mac and we must say MADE TO PERFECTION!!!!!  We will definitely be coming back!!!'

text: 'I definitely recommend BK Lobster. My friend and I tried it for the first time and so we ordered a variety of items and EVERYTHING was sooooo delicious!!!!!!'

text: 'I ordered with UberEats. The bk sauce lobster roll was delicious. That being said
column5: I was most looking forward to the lobster Mac and cheese

author: Jacqueline Aguilar
text: 'Omg!!!! Lobster rolls! ü¶û super delicious. I had the classic my partner had the butter and lemon. I really loved the buttery lemon lobster roll with a side spring salad.  Amazing!!  Fresh!  10 stars. They also serve decent portions so you‚Äôre definitely getting your money‚Äôs worth. Also
column5: the fries are heavily seasoned - wasn‚Äôt my  fave. But still good. :) can‚Äôt wait to come back.. I‚Äôm already planning on it.'

author: Gloria Grant
text: 'I had fried lobster and fries. The food was tasty. The fries were seasoned. I also got steamed lobster to go with fries. Which I ate the next day and it was good'

author: Alexis Stanley
text: 'This place did not disappoint at all. I met a friend for lunch at BK Lobster in Hoboken and honestly this is one of the best lobster rolls I\'ve ever had. When we arrived the owner was there and gave us first class service from start to finish. They don\'t really have a lot of seating inside so we sat outside at one of their sidewalk tables. My friend got the classic lobster roll and I got the "crown heights" roll which was fried lobster and some sort of aioli. It was so good. It comes with fries or a salad and I chose the fries but they gave us so much I barely finished. Also as it\'s moniker states this place exclusively sells only lobster rolls (i think they might have salads but why go to a lobster roll place if u wanna get a salad you know?). I definitely would come back.'

author: kelsy saldana
text: 'An absolute joke of a store. They treated my girlfriend terribly. A grown woman by the name of Tiff curses at her staff
column5: yelled and cursed at my girlfriend who is SEVENTEEN YEARS OLD for simply doing her job
column6: and was unpleasantly rude when I tried to enter the store. Embarrassing and obviously disrespectful type of management.'

author: David Torres
text: "Didn't have a great experience here

author: Jessie Bell
text: 'Food is very tasty but a bit pricey.'

author: Gold Poodle
text: 'I have been to many BK Lobster locations between  NY and NJ.  All locations between NY and NJ have  been consistent and the food is very tasty.   The staff and management work very hard to satisfy their customers and communities.  Very impressive that the Hoboken location came up with the Hoboken roll for the Hoboken community.  Anyone can get the lobster roll classics as well as the scrumptious new options such as the Italian Bay Ridge Roll and the Jamaican Jerk sauce roll
column5: the Flatbush roll.    The Fries
column6: the fries
column7: the fries‚Ä¶. Whether lightly seasoned or well-season
column8: can never pass up on fries!'

author: Kelly Oliva
text: 'Terrible service. The lobster was dry and chewy. The seasoning doesn‚Äôt taste good.'

author: Joseph Fung
text: 'For the lobster lover
column5: there\'s a nice assortment of appetizers and entrees. The lobster roll variety goes beyond the standard Maine and Connecticut styles
column6: and adds some unique signature offerings
column9: and Flatbush Roll. The latter two are drizzled with chipotle and jerk sauce
column11: to add a nice kick. If you\'re not in the mood for a roll
column12: go for the Fried Lobster. You get chunks of perfectly fried and lightly battered lobster that is not greasy or overcooked. All are served with tasty
column13: seasoned fries. This will be a fine addition to Hoboken
column15: and is a step above the old Luke\'s Lobster that used to be in town. During Grand Opening
column16: they were a bit disorganized and waits were around half an hour
column17: but the staff was earnest. Chalk it up to opening day issues.'

author: T. Pisani
text: "I was excited to see this place was coming to town and wanted to give it a fair shot. Overall the food was decent but just overpriced. $22 for a 6 inch lobster roll?? Nuts. It's one thing for a sit down restaurant with waiters but for a fast takeout place the price needs to be closer to $15 to make me ever go back."

author: Alan K
text: 'Sunday afternoon
column5: slow and i walk right in to order. The staff has no clue what they are doing and the lady that works at the front was not pleasant. Lobster and fries took over 30 min!? You‚Äôre the lobster place. Put it on the roll salt the fries and let‚Äôs go. Holy moly.\n\nI don‚Äôt want to come back here. I read the reviews and saw similar comments from weeks ago and no improvement. Hey owner!
column6: I eat out all the time (nice)
column8: let‚Äôs assume my lady and I eat 3 meals a month between us on average. You just lost $900 a year! Not good!\n\nGet your staff to know the basic stuff
column10: and don‚Äôt take 30 min! Ez peezy!'

text: 'Food was great! Can‚Äôt wait to try other menu items.'

author: Krys c
text: "This was my first made to order Lobster roll experience

column7: there was a little wait but I expected that on opening weekend! I've since returned and the efficiency was on point
column8: great to see. I received my roll within 5 minutes.\n\nI've tried the biggie
column11: all very flavorful and surprisingly had a lot of lobster meat

text: 'Fried shrimp & fries for the win!!! Love this place & it‚Äôs black & woman owned!! üëèüèΩüëèüèΩüëèüèΩ'

author: Tiffany Lewis
text: 'Food is amazing and the staff was very friendly.'

author: Chi Iregbulem
text: "I went on opening day because I support Black and woman-owned small businesses. I returned a week later because the food is delicious. The Bed-Stuy lobster roll I ordered was fresh
column5: flavorful and accompanied by hot seasoned fries. There is also a yummy vegan option that I also tried during my next visit that didn't disappoint. I found the service to be warm and welcoming despite how busy it was and I sincerely hope that BK Lobster continues to succeed and thrive in Hoboken."

author: Da Print Spot
text: 'Great seafood takeout options but most impressing they have vegan options!!!! Tasty food upbeat staff amazing experience'

author: Molly's Closet
text: 'I‚Äôve never had take out seafood THIS GOODDD!\nThe fried shrimp paired with season fries is my favorite alongside the Flatbush LOBSTER roll! I am absolutely NOT a fan of lobster but Coming from the Caribbean the Flatbush roll definitely reminded me of my roots
column5: with the consistency of the island flavor throughout the entire lobster roll
column6: & it was cooked to perfection (NOT UNDER OR OVER COOKED) it was nothing short of amazing ! I will definitely be back & shoutout to the superb staff and attentiveness to my order. This was a great experience.'

author: ottavia salvemini
text: 'I really had high hopes for this place it has great reviews
column5: it was so so disappointing!!! I ordered a Connecticut roll $21 and a Bed Stuy Roll for like $28 both were exactly the same taste & looked the same.  Then I ordered the fried lobster all I tasted was the batter didn‚Äôt taste like lobster at all!!  They seem to use the claws of the lobster mostly I really didn‚Äôt see lobster tail!! That seasoning they put on everything is not good at all I hated it so much!!! When I get lobster rolls from the Point in Point Pleasant you see the lobster meat tail and all that‚Äôs a lobster roll
column6: not this chopped up whatever BK lobster serves!  The service I gave a decent tip and waited for like 45 min  people that came after me got their food they gave me one of my rolls had to wait another half an hour for the rest.  I will never go back not worth it al all!!!'

text: 'Overpriced for what you get which is mainly a lot of undercooked French Fries but seasoned nicely. I ordered 2 Bed Stuy Biggie Rolls. First they tried to overcharge me by including the tax in the item price and then adding tax again to the sub total. The cashier couldn‚Äôt figure it out!? Finally had to enter a custom priced item?? Watch your charges. The Brioche roll is good
column5: the lobster meat and portion size was okay but a little dry. They melt a little butter and lemon juice with it in an oven to heat up each portion then sprinkle a little Old Bay type seasoning on. I‚Äôve had much better at the Jersey shore for less money.'

author: Sharon Montero (ItsLaLocaTV)
text: 'Been waiting to try since the started building out the spot and they did not disappoint. Super tasty
column5: a little pricey but u get good portions. I mean it‚Äôs price is right for the area. I ordered the biggie Smalls and wings (9 I think) and it totaled $41.03. I‚Äôm not a baller and try not to splurge so much but since it was my bday I thought I‚Äôd treat myself to a delicious meal. Not disappointed!!! Now will I return?!?!? Heck yes cause the food good but will it be a wkly thing no cause I got a body to keep snatched and purse to keep fat but once in a while I‚Äôll let loose.'

author: Valerie Lawson
text: "I loved
column5: loved
column6: loved the food and the staff. The staff had on Black T-shirts that had business name on Front& Staff names on back of shirts. Very friendly staff

author: Jeffrey Richman
text: 'As a new Englander

text: 'This is my new favorite lobster spot period. If you live in NYC or come to visit you have to try the Bed Stuy Biggie Roll. The shrimp and the fried lobster was fire too üî•'

text: 'Wonderful! Just what is needed yo Hoboken.'

author: Tiesha Rogers
text: 'The best place to get your lobster from. They have great customer service and food. The place is clean'

author: Yolanda Flores
text: 'Was very excited today for BK Lobster to come to Hoboken
column5: told family and friends about the grand opening
column6: but what a let down. First and foremost there was no organization nor no practicing 6 feet distance. Everyone was bunched in
column7: no structure. I couldn‚Äôt tell who were the employees just people walking in or out. No one greeting anyone or at least giving directions where to stand on line to order. It was just chaos‚Äôs. That‚Äôs not even the bad part
column10: 2 fried lobster I got my order at 10:15
column11: 35 minutes of waiting. At one point I had to flag down whom appeared to be an employee and ask if they can check on my order. Apparently I think they skipped my order because I observed them as the employee was inquiring about my order then you can see them searching for my name and then that was another 15 minute wait. I felt embarrassed at one point because everyone kept staring at me like saying why is she still here. It was awkward! The bad part I left a nice tip and the food was cold. The food looked like they rush to put the order together because they knew they messed up my order. No Bueno!! Very disappointed with BK Lobster in my home town. Moving forward wish you all the best.'

author: Kimberley Coke
text: 'Food was amazing! Great addition to Washington Street and Hoboken!'
